title: Brave New World
description: A futuristic society controlled by technology and conditioning.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A young girl's journey through racial injustice in the Deep South.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A teenager’s perspective on society and growing up.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry.

title: Moby Dick
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest for revenge.

title: The Road
description: A post-apocalyptic tale of a father and son’s survival.

title: Beloved
description: A haunting tale of slavery and its aftermath.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: A satirical novel about the bombing of Dresden in WWII.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A philosophical study of guilt and redemption.

title: Frankenstein
description: A scientist’s dangerous experiment creates a living monster.

title: Jane Eyre
description: An orphan girl overcomes hardships to find love and independence.

title: The Book Thief
description: A young girl steals books and shares them in Nazi Germany.

title: Steve Jobs
description: The biography of Apple’s iconic co-founder.

title: Educated
description: A memoir about a woman who escapes her survivalist family to pursue education.

title: Gone Girl
description: A suspenseful thriller about a missing wife and hidden secrets.

title: The Hobbit
description: Bilbo Baggins goes on a quest with dwarves to reclaim treasure.

title: It
description: A group of children face a terrifying clown-like entity in their town.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: Explores the history and impact of Homo sapiens on the world.

title: The Sun and Her Flowers
description: A collection of poems about love, loss, and healing.

title: Atomic Habits
description: A guide on building good habits and breaking bad ones.

title: The Night Circus
description: A magical competition between two illusionists in a mystical circus.
